bill_title: authorize use of special education funds for initiatives at the South Dakota School for the Blind and the Visually Impaired and the South Dakota School for the Deaf.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a Board of Regents Advisory Council. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Governor shall appoint a Board of Regents Advisory Council on the South Dakota School for the Blind and Visually Impaired and the South Dakota School for the Deaf. The Governor shall select members after soliciting recommendations from the Board of Regents and representative organizations that represent individuals with sensory disabilities or their families. The Governor shall consider, to the greatest extent practicable, geographical distribution on the council. The council shall be composed of twelve members including: (1) One representative of the Board of Regents; (2) One parent of a current student at the South Dakota School for the Blind and Visually Impaired and one parent of a current student at the South Dakota School for the Deaf; (3) One public school administrator; (4) One special education administrator or university instructor with knowledge of sensory disabilities; (5) Two blind or visually impaired individuals and two deaf or hard of hearing individuals who are knowledgeable of the skills necessary for students with a disability to succeed in adult life; and (6) Three at large members. Each member of the council shall serve for a term of three years with no more than four expiring each year. No member of the council may serve more than two consecutive terms. The superintendent of the South Dakota School for the Blind and Visually Impaired and the superintendent for the South Dakota School for the Deaf shall serve as ex officio, nonvoting members of the council. Section 2. The Board of Regents Advisory Council shall meet at least three times annually at a place and time designated by the Board of Regents. The council shall review, analyze, and advise the Board of Regents regarding the performance of the South Dakota School for the Blind and Visually Impaired and the South Dakota School for the Deaf relating to: (1) Eligibility for participation in educational services; (2) The extent, scope, and effectiveness of services; and (3) Functions performed by the special schools that affect the abilities of students with sensory disabilities to achieve meaningful employment and independent living status. The council shall annually review student, parent, teacher, and school district satisfaction with the services provided by the special schools. The council shall prepare and submit an annual report to the Board of Regents and the Governor on the status of the special schools. Under the direction and control of the executive director of the Board of Regents, the special schools will provide the council sufficient resources, including staff, necessary to carry out the functions specified in this Act.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize use of special education funds for initiatives at the South Dakota School for the Blind and the Visually Impaired and the South Dakota School for the Deaf. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-37-13 be amended to read as follows: 13-37-13. Neither the The secretary of the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs , nor or any school district shall may expend any public funds under the provisions of this chapter for the education of children in need enrolled in any state-owned institution, except for including transportation as provided in § 13-37-8.9. The provisions of this chapter may apply to approved programs and services provided by state universities and colleges, and for assignment to institutions outside of South Dakota for services not available within the state. BILL HISTORY 1/24/00 First read in House and referred to committee assignment waived. H.J. 205 1/25/00 Referred to Education. 2/8/00 Education Hog Housed. 2/8/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/8/00 Education Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 12, NAYS 0. H.J. 481
